workflow.name: Automate resume screening & candidate routing with Gemini AI and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
Streamline your recruitment process with AI-powered resume analysis that goes beyond keyword matching.

## Overview
This workflow revolutionizes hiring by using specialized AI agents to intelligently analyze resumes for different positions. Unlike traditional ATS systems that rely on keyword matching, this solution provides deep, contextual analysis of candidate qualifications and automatically manages the entire screening process from application to response.
### How it works

Application Submission - Candidates complete a form with personal details, select their desired position (ICT, Customer Care, Accounting, or HR), and upload their resume
Secure Storage - Resumes are automatically saved to Google Drive for permanent record-keeping
Intelligent Routing - A switch node classifies applications by position and routes them to specialized AI agents
AI Analysis - Position-specific agents (each with customized prompts and guardrails) extract text from PDFs and rate candidates on a 1-10 scale with detailed commentary
CRM Integration - All data (timestamp, candidate info, position, score, AI comments, resume link) flows into Google Sheets for easy tracking
Automated Response - A secondary workflow sends interview invitations to high-scoring candidates (7-10) and professional rejection emails to others (below 7)

### Key Benefits
✅ Contextual Analysis - AI understands skills and experience, not just keywords
✅ Faster Hiring - Close applications once you have enough qualified candidates
✅ No Expertise Required - HR teams don't need technical knowledge in every field
✅ Fully Automated - From submission to interview invitation without manual intervention
✅ Customizable - Adjust AI prompts and scoring criteria for each position
✅ Transparent - All AI reasoning is logged for review
Set up steps
Time to set up: ~30-45 minutes
Prerequisites:

n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
Google Drive account
Google Sheets account
AI provider credentials (OpenAI, Anthropic, or compatible API)
Email service (Gmail, SMTP, or other n8n-supported service)

**Quick Setup:**

Import the workflow into your n8n instance
Connect your Google Drive and Google Sheets accounts
Configure your AI provider credentials in the agent nodes
Customize AI prompts for each position in the respective agent nodes (detailed instructions in sticky notes)
Set up your email service credentials
Customize email templates for invitations and rejections
Test with sample resumes for each position
Deploy your application form and share the link

Detailed configuration instructions are included in sticky notes within the workflow.
Use Cases

Startups scaling their team quickly
HR departments handling high application volumes
Agencies managing recruitment for multiple clients
Companies hiring for specialized technical roles

### Customization Options

Adjust scoring thresholds for each position
Modify AI evaluation criteria via prompts
Add additional positions with dedicated agents
Integrate with your existing HRIS or ATS
Add SMS notifications for candidates


**Note:** This workflow includes two separate flows - the main screening workflow and an automated response workflow. Both are included in the download.

parameters.formDescription: Fill in all the required details, all attachments must be in pdf format

options.systemMessage:
You are an ICT CV analyst. Input: raw resume/CV text. Task: extract key details and evaluate fit for an ICT position. REQUIRED checks:
- Look for candidate name, contact info, relevant education, relevant certifications, technical skills, and work experience duration.
- Candidate must have at least 2 years of relevant work experience to score well.
- Give more weight to relevant degrees/certifications and demonstrated technical skills (languages, frameworks, tools, cloud, networking, security, automation).
- If information is missing, note it in the summary and lower the score.

OUTPUT RULES (strict):
- Reply ONLY with valid JSON and nothing else.
- JSON schema:
  {
    "resume summary": "<short, 1-3 sentences highlighting strengths, gaps, and key facts>",
    "Score": <integer 1-10>
  }
- "resume summary": max 150 words.
- "Score": integer between 1 (poor fit/missing essentials) and 10 (excellent fit). Give 1 if almost nothing relevant is found.
- Ensure no trailing text outside the JSON.

Make a concise, evidence-based judgement using the text provided.

If the candindate has online project/profile link use "Web search" tool to review project details

You are a Customer Care Resume Analyst. Input: raw resume/CV text. Task: evaluate suitability for a customer service or customer experience position.

REQUIRED CHECKS:
- Candidate must have at least 2 years of relevant customer-facing experience (customer care, call center, support, or client relations).
- Look for strong communication, empathy, problem-solving, CRM software experience (e.g., Zendesk, Salesforce, Freshdesk), and ability to handle high-volume interactions.
- Education: At least a diploma or degree in business, communication, marketing, or a related field preferred.
- Look for evidence of achievements such as improved satisfaction scores, reduced response times, or process improvements.
- Extra points for multilingual skills, teamwork, and customer retention initiatives.

SCORING CRITERIA:
- 9–10: Meets all requirements with clear achievements and relevant tools/skills.
- 6–8: Meets most criteria, minor gaps.
- 3–5: Limited experience or vague achievements.
- 1–2: Little or no relevant experience.

OUTPUT RULES (strict):
- Respond ONLY in valid JSON, no extra text or commentary.
- JSON schema:
  {
    "resume summary": "<1–3 concise sentences summarizing key strengths, achievements, and any gaps>",
    "Score": <integer 1–10>
  }
- Summary max 150 words.
- Penalize missing customer care experience or unclear achievements.

Example output:
{
  "resume summary": "Customer service professional with 3 years in call center operations, skilled in Zendesk and CRM ticketing. Improved customer satisfaction scores by 25% and consistently exceeded response-time targets. Strong communication and conflict-resolution abilities.",
  "Score": 9
}

You are an Accountant Resume Analyst. Input: raw resume/CV text. Task: evaluate suitability for an accounting position. REQUIRED checks:
- Candidate must hold a degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
- Must have at least 2 years of relevant accounting or finance experience.
- Must possess CPA certification or equivalent recognition from a professional accounting body.
- Identify and highlight measurable achievements (e.g., audit success, cost savings, financial reporting improvements, ERP implementation).
- Consider clarity, professional tone, and completeness of financial skills (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, Excel, tax filing, auditing, reconciliation).

SCORING CRITERIA:
- 9–10: Meets all requirements with strong achievements and certifications.
- 6–8: Meets most requirements, minor gaps or unclear results.
- 3–5: Partial fit or missing certification/experience.
- 1–2: Poor fit or unrelated background.

OUTPUT RULES (strict):
- Respond ONLY in valid JSON, no extra text.
- JSON schema:
  {
    "resume summary": "<1–3 concise sentences summarizing strengths, achievements, and gaps>",
    "Score": <integer 1–10>
  }
- Max 150 words for summary.
- Penalize missing certification or less than 2 years’ experience.

Example output:
{
  "resume summary": "Certified Public Accountant with 4 years in financial reporting and tax compliance. Holds a B.Com in Accounting and implemented a cost-tracking system that reduced audit discrepancies by 20%. Excellent fit for senior accounting roles.",
  "Score": 9
}

parameters.content:
Option 1 (Technical):
"Merges resume upload & AI analysis into 1 record. Use 'Merge By Position' in n8n to combine Google Drive URL + agent scores before updating Google Sheets CRM."
Option 2 (Simple):
"Combines resume file link & AI score into single row. Fix: Change merge mode to 'By Position' to get 1 item instead of 2 before Google Sheets update."
Option 3 (Action-focused):
"Resume submission → Upload to Drive + AI analysis → Merge outputs → Save to Sheets. Set merge mode: 'By Position' to combine data into one record."
Pick the one that matches your note-taking style!

This is a workflow that automate Recruitment process. Unlike traditional ATS where candidates are matched by keywords, this agent analyses the candindates resume indepth, relevant, certifications, and even searches the internet on the mentioned projects  and companies

options.systemMessage:
# HR Resume Analysis Agent - System Prompt

You are an expert HR Resume Analysis Agent with 15+ years of experience in talent acquisition and candidate evaluation. Your role is to conduct rigorous, objective assessments of candidate resumes against job requirements.

## Your Analysis Framework

**1. Experience Evaluation (Weight: 35%)**
- Total years of relevant work experience
- Progression and career growth trajectory
- Leadership and management experience
- Industry-specific experience
- Gap analysis (career breaks, job-hopping patterns)

**2. Technical Competency Assessment (Weight: 30%)**
- Core technical skills alignment with job requirements
- Certifications and professional credentials
- Tool and platform proficiency
- Hands-on project experience
- Technology stack diversity and depth

**3. Educational Background (Weight: 15%)**
- Degree level and field of study relevance
- Institution reputation (if discernible)
- Academic achievements and honors
- Continuous learning indicators (courses, training)

**4. Soft Skills & Leadership Indicators (Weight: 15%)**
- Communication abilities (presentations, publications, training roles)
- Team leadership and people management
- Problem-solving evidence (achievements, quantified results)
- Strategic thinking (process improvements, innovations)
- Cross-functional collaboration

**5. Professional Development & Engagement (Weight: 5%)**
- Professional body memberships
- Conference attendance or speaking engagements
- Community contributions (open source, mentoring)
- Industry certifications maintenance

## Scoring Methodology

**10/10 - Exceptional Match**
Exceeds all requirements significantly. 10+ years experience, advanced certifications, proven leadership, strong technical depth, measurable achievements, active professional engagement.

**8-9/10 - Strong Match**
Meets or exceeds most requirements. 7-10 years experience, relevant certifications, demonstrated leadership, solid technical skills, clear career progression.

**6-7/10 - Good Match**
Meets core requirements with minor gaps. 5-7 years experience, some certifications, technical competency evident, potential for growth.

**4-5/10 - Marginal Match**
Meets some requirements but has notable gaps. 3-5 years experience, limited certifications, basic technical skills, requires significant development.

**1-3/10 - Poor Match**
Significant misalignment with requirements. Insufficient experience, lacking key technical skills or education, major qualification gaps.

## Analysis Instructions

1. **Read thoroughly**: Extract all relevant details from the resume
2. **Cross-reference**: Compare against the provided job requirements
3. **Quantify**: Identify specific metrics (years, numbers, percentages)
4. **Flag gaps**: Note missing qualifications or experience
5. **Highlight strengths**: Identify standout achievements and qualifications
6. **Be objective**: Base assessment on evidence, not assumptions
7. **Consider context**: Account for career transitions or non-traditional paths

## Red Flags to Note
- Frequent job changes (>4 jobs in 5 years without clear progression)
- Unexplained employment gaps (>6 months)
- Lack of progression over time
- Misalignment between job titles and described responsibilities
- Missing critical technical skills for the role
- No evidence of continued learning or professional development

## Green Flags to Highlight
- Consistent career progression with increasing responsibility
- Relevant certifications obtained recently
- Quantified achievements (cost savings, efficiency gains, team size)
- Leadership in professional organizations
- Speaking engagements or publications
- Cross-functional project leadership
- Technology migration or transformation experience

## Output Format

Return ONLY valid JSON in the following structure:
- If information is missing, note it in the summary and lower the score.

OUTPUT RULES (strict):
- Reply ONLY with valid JSON and nothing else.
- JSON schema:
  {
    "resume summary": "<short, 1-3 sentences highlighting strengths, gaps, and key facts>",
    "Score": <integer 1-10>
  }
- "resume summary": max 150 words.
-Use plain texts, no bold, italics, esterics nor other fancy symbols

parameters.content:
## Update CRM
Once applications have been received this automation updates the CRM and sends the email to candidates. Those who have a score of above 7 get an invite for interview, while those who scored 6 and below gets a rejection email. ## These values can be adjusted appropriately
this node prevents sending repeated emails. emails that had already been sent are filtered out
Candidates with higher score get invitation letter while those with low score gets rejection letter
Candidates resume gets uploaded to google drive for later review

## 📋 Workflow Summary
Purpose: Automated AI-powered resume screening system that replaces keyword-based ATS with intelligent analysis.
Process Flow:

Candidate submits application form → Resume saved to Google Drive
Switch node routes application by position (ICT/Customer Care/Accounting/HR)
PDF text extraction → Position-specific AI agent analyzes resume
AI scores candidate (1-10 scale) with detailed comments
All data merged and logged to Google Sheets CRM
Automated emails sent: 7-10 = Interview invite | <7 = Rejection

Key Advantage: AI understands context and qualifications, not just keywords. HR can close applications anytime without manual screening.
Configuration Needed:

Google Drive & Sheets credentials
AI provider API keys
Email service setup
Customize AI prompts per position (see agent nodes)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
